description: A tool to identify differences of protein molecular dynamics from two MD simulation trajectories in terms of interresidue contacts.
name: MDContactCom

metadata.abstract: Comparing results from multiple MD simulations performed under different conditions is essential during the initial stages of analysis. We propose a tool called MD Contact Comparison (MDContactCom) that compares residue-residue contact fluctuations of two MD trajectories, quantifies the differences, identifies sites that exhibit large differences and visualizes those sites on the protein structure. Using this method, it is possible to identify sites affected by varying simulation conditions and reveal the path of propagation of the effect even when differences between the 3D structure of the molecule and the fluctuation RMSF of each residue is unclear. MDContactCom can monitor differences in complex protein dynamics between two MD trajectories and identify candidate sites to be analyzed in more detail. As such, MDContactCom is a versatile software package for analyzing most MD simulations.
metadata.title: MDContactCom: a tool to identify differences of protein molecular dynamics from two MD simulation trajectories in terms of interresidue contacts
